Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that all 44 senators voted against sending stimulus checks, as the Senate voted unanimously in favor of the stimulus package.
Understate: The claim understates the complexity and drama surrounding the passage of the stimulus package, as there were policy disagreements and procedural votes that initially blocked the bill's progress.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that 44 senators voted against sending stimulus checks.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 44 senators mentioned in the social media posts voted against sending stimulus checks, without considering the broader context of the stimulus package and the voting process.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the 44 senators may have had objections to certain aspects of the stimulus package, but ultimately voted in favor of its passage.
